channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: ST Now, News As It Happens - May 3, 2020
item.description:
May 03, 2020 6:06 AM

Welcome to ST Now, News As It Happens. Reach us at stshare@sph.com.sg or on Facebook and Twitter @STcom.

item.title: Fiji helps lone S’porean on damaged yacht stranded at sea for a month
Parents of newborn both had Covid-19
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Like all good stories, this one has something to do with time: two hours to be exact.

item.title: Medical, tech investments pay off in Covid-19 war
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The world is fighting a war against a virus and Singapore scientists are pulling their weight when it comes to building up an arsenal of knowledge that can be used to vanquish the enemy.

item.title: Workplaces must put in place more stringent rules
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Some workplaces that meet a range of criteria will be gradually reopened from May 12, but more stringent requirements will be imposed, it was announced yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hear from 7 on the ground
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

I patrol the streets and help to maintain law and order... Now, more people are starting to take (the circuit breaker rules) seriously. But there are still some whom we have to explain the seriousness of the situation to. ''

item.title: His heart stopped beating for 16 minutes
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

For 42 days, Mr Toh Kai Kiat's family endured a roller-coaster ride of emotions.

item.title: Drug being studied here gets US nod for emergency use
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A drug for Covid-19 that is being studied in Singapore was approved for emergency use in severely ill patients in the United States on Friday. It is remdesivir, an experimental anti-viral drug that blocks the coronavirus from replicating.

item.title: Jogging in park, taking MRT? Scan QR code
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

People who go jogging in parks or use the MRT are encouraged to scan in using QR codes at entrances to enable contact tracing.

item.title: Travel firm continues to engage customers, with eye on recovery
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The travel industry may have come to a standstill due to the coronavirus, but companies and travel agents are continuing to engage customers online and taking up training courses in preparation for recovery.

item.title: Winning cash and bonding over ST colouring contest
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

With his traditional Chinese medicine clinic in the Orchard area shut because of the tightened circuit breaker measures, Mr Chiang Yok Wah was worried about meeting the rent that was due.

item.title: Residents of condominiums may exercise in common areas from May 5
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Residents living in strata-titled residential properties such as condominiums will be able to exercise within the common areas of these private developments from May 5, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday.

item.title: Developing tests to diagnose Covid-19 in minutes
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

In an outbreak of an infectious disease like Covid-19, diagnosing patients is a key first step to preventing its spread. Identifying infected patients allows doctors to quickly ring-fence them, so they do not spread the virus to others while they are being treated.

item.title: A dinner where death lurked
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

It was a boisterous and lively Chinese New Year dinner that dragged on for five hours, with guests shuttling between tables to chit-chat and pose for wefies with one another, recalls case 130 of a celebration he and his wife attended at Safra Jurong on Feb 15.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protecting Singaporeans' livelihoods MOM's top priority, says Josephine Teo
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Fresh graduates facing a job market weakened by Covid-19 will be helped, Manpower Minister Josephine Teo said.

item.title: Tightened circuit breaker measures to stay for another week
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The stiffer circuit breaker measures, which were meant to be in place until May 4, have been extended by a week, as Singapore has not brought the number of coronavirus infections in the community consistently down to single digits.

item.title: At 102, she fought and beat Covid-19
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

As she was wheeled into Lee Ah Mooi Old Age Home on Friday, Madam Yap Lay Hong was greeted with beaming faces and cries of joy from staff and residents.

item.title: Coronavirus: Precautionary measures updated as new findings emerge, says Lawrence Wong
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

With more information emerging about the coronavirus, the Government has been implementing and updating precautionary measures as and when new medical findings are made, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong told The Sunday Times in an interview marking the 100-day mark of the outbreak here.

item.title: Easing measures a balance between need and risks
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The circuit breaker restrictions will be eased gradually and businesses will have to meet certain criteria before they can resume their operations.

item.title: 'I was shocked and cried non-stop'
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Nearly a month after testing positive for the coronavirus, Madam Sylvia Sim is still unsure how she caught it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Years of effort behind robust supply chains
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's efforts over the years in preparing for possible disruptions to its supply chains have allowed it "to move quickly and activate new contingency options as others closed" amid the coronavirus pandemic, said Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing.

item.title: Lessons in schools for small groups, with focus on graduating cohorts
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Schools can start bringing in students in small groups for face-to-face lessons from May 19 as circuit breaker measures slowly ease up, it was announced yesterday.

item.title: Racing to figure out and get ahead of virus
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

"It doesn't quite matter to me now what time I go home," says Professor Leo Yee Sin, executive director of the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID). "Because I continue to work at home."

item.title: Elderly residents in homes a priority in Covid-19 testing
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Testing for the coronavirus will be prioritised for the elderly residents and staff of all homes that serve seniors.

item.title: Home-based food businesses can resume operations from May 12
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Home-based food businesses will be allowed to resume operations from May 12, said the Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources in a statement yesterday.

item.title: Finding himself in the middle of a virus war
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Thirty-three-year-old Dr Tay Woo Chiao started his stint at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) in January, expecting to deal with patients with known diseases such as HIV infection and dengue fever.

item.title: 447 new cases in S'pore; 17th death reported
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 447 new coronavirus cases were confirmed as of noon yesterday, said the Ministry of Health (MOH).

item.title: Coronavirus: Be prepared psychologically for a long fight, says Heng Swee Keat
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

One hundred days after Singapore's first case of Covid-19, one key thing learnt about the new coronavirus is how it is very agile and spreads very rapidly, and at an exponential pace if not contained, said Deputy Prime Minister Heng Swee Keat.

item.title: Staying calm and positive despite fear and stress
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The cards provide motivation, they offer comfort, they are perhaps reminders of her purpose. The cards arrive at the hospital from strangers, scribbles on blue paper, hearts drawn in black, and she takes these home and sticks them to her wall.

item.title: Screen time without guilt
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

When the circuit breaker measures were announced almost a month ago, Dr Andrew Yee quickly drew up a home-based learning timetable for his four-year-old son.

item.title: PSP expels member over video claiming links to foreign sources
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The Progress Singapore Party (PSP) expelled a member on Friday for making a video in the style of hacktivist group Anonymous in which he claims the party has been infiltrated and funded by foreign sources.

item.title: No effort spared to push out timely and reliable updates, says Iswaran
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

No effort has been spared to give Singaporeans reliable and timely access to information involving Covid-19 across as many platforms as possible, Minister for Communications and Information S. Iswaran said.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pulling out all the stops to save lives, and the economy
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

The Covid-19 pandemic in Singapore has required a coordinated response from the Government to tackle the health, social and economic upheavals it has wrought.

item.title: Stay home for the holidays? Yes, you can
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Over the past 31/2 weeks of learning and working from home under the circuit breaker measures, families in Singapore have settled into a routine.

item.title: Architect's black-white approach draws praise
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Architect Cliff Tan would get a daily nudge from his mother, 69, to take part in The Straits Times #STayhome #STaysafe Colouring Challenge.

item.title: Healthcare workers the most important resource in battle
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Healthcare workers are the most important resource in the country's fight against Covid-19, said Health Minister Gan Kim Yong, who paid tribute to them over the Labour Day weekend.

item.title: After a deep recession, a different economy
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

Just over 100 days ago, on Jan 15, the United States and China signed their phase one trade agreement, agreeing to halve some tariffs and suspend others, which kindled hopes that the two-year-long US-China trade war might be winding down.

item.title: Elderly must continue to be extra cautious, not time yet to relax
item.description:
May 03, 2020 5:00 AM

This is not the time to relax, the multi-ministry task force handling the pandemic said yesterday, as it highlighted the need for the elderly to continue to be extra cautious despite the easing of some circuit breaker measures from May 5.

item.title: Like a long-distance swimmer, we must endure
